title: Pulse Check
description: This is a quick survey to measure the company’s engagement.

questions.text: It is easy to bury myself in my work.
I’m excited to start my workweek.
I would recommend this company as a great place to work.
What are things we are doing well as a company?
What can we improve in our company?

title: Employee Net Promoter Score (eNPS)
description: This survey is designed to capture the company's internal happiness and loyalty. The questions are inspired by the Net Promoter® Score template, an industry standard survey to gather customer satisfaction.

questions.text: How likely are you to recommend our company to friends as a place to work?
What changes would we have to make to receive an even higher rating?

title: Engagement Survey
description: This survey’s purpose is to obtain holistic feedback on the company’s leadership, enablement, alignment and development.

questions.text: The company leaders keep people informed about what's happening.
The company leaders have set clear goals for the company.
I know how my work contributes to achieving the company’s goals.
My manager has shown a genuine interest in my career.
I have a healthy work-life balance.
I am given the opportunities to develop skills relevant to my interests.
I have access to the tools and equipment I need to do my job well.
I have access to the learning and development I need to do my job well.
The systems and processes here support me in getting my work done effectively.
I know what I need to do to be successful in my role.
I'm proud to be part of this company.
I would recommend this company as a great place to work to my friends and family.
Most days, I'm happy to start my work week.
I plan on being with this company for the foreseeable future.
This company makes me want to do my best work.
My manager has created a trusting, open environment.
My manager often provides constructive feedback.
I feel valued at work.
I am recognized for my good work.
Leadership seriously listens to feedback.
Provide any additional feedback for the leadership team.

title: Pre Open Enrollment Survey
description: This survey will measure if people are satisfied with the company’s current health benefit offerings.

questions.text: Overall I am satisfied with the benefits package my organization offers.
My company offers affordable health benefit packages.
I have a clear understanding of the benefits package offered by my company.
I am satisfied with the current provider network and access to care.
I would recommend this company as a great place to work based on the current benefits packages.
Are there any benefits that you’d like us to offer? List the three most important to you.
Which already offered benefits are most important to you?

Rank the top 3 items that’ll impact your benefits election: 1: Lower copays // 2: Lower plan premiums // 3: Lower out-of-pocket maximum // 4: Lower deductible // 5: Broader network of providers // 6: Lower prescription drug costs

title: Post Open Enrollment Survey
description: This survey’s intent is to gather feedback on the company’s health benefit offerings in the most recent open enrollment.

questions.text: Overall I am satisfied with the benefits package my organization offers.
My company offers affordable health benefit packages.
I have a clear understanding of the benefits package offered by my company.
I am satisfied with the current provider network and access to care.
I would recommend this company as a great place to work based on the current benefits packages.
I am satisfied with the overall benefits enrollment experience.
I felt confident in my ability to make my plan selections.
I knew who/where to go to if I had questions during open enrollment.
Are there any other benefits that you’d like us to offer?
Which already offered benefits are most important to you?

title: Work-Life Flexibility
description: This is a quick survey to assess the company’s work-life balance.

questions.text: I am able to navigate my work responsibilities along with my personal needs
I am able to get the most important things done on a day to day or week to week basis.
I am able to spend the right amount of time with my family and friends
I am able to enjoy my time away from work, whether it is a vacation day or just the weekend, without worrying about my work.
